column5: Carped the Harbour on Friday and Sunday...  Hooked into this litte guy on Friday... First fish i've taken with the high tech carp set up...(pod, buzzer, baitrunner and hair rig...)    Sunday morning i hooked up with Fang and we gave it another run... no luck - the cold front saturday didn't help at all

Nice job, Uncle Buck.  Isn't it sweet when that bite alarm goes off, you engage the baitrunner reel, lift the rod up and feel that train on the end of your line!!!  Really nice when everything, right down to the hair rig, works exactly the way it should.  That's it.. I'm gonna give 'er a go tomorrow night after work!  Thanks for posting!

Great report!  I dont have all the bells and whistles yet.  My bite indicator is my index finger...resting  on the line while I sit very still....LOL.  I haven't caught fish in a week now....maybe I'll have to head out tonite...as long as it's not raining too hard...haha.  Thanks...great pic!
the feeling is just amazing eh ... hearing the alarm go off and seeing ur lines peeling out from ur reel ...  nice fish!

I also like to fish for trash fish as well! I've had more trashcan slams than I can count  In some circles I'm known as the Trash King!!!  Just because a fish isn't considered a game fish doesn't mean that it isn't a Brute on the end of your line. In some states here the lowly Catfish is considered a gamefish with length and creel limits!
U.B. you had the trout pose....with a carp.... see how Victor did it the right way in his post ... just kidding.  Congratulations on the catch, it only gets better now ;-)
For those who know (or don't know) UB, That's a 30 lber he's holding  Great morning Goran, have to do it again real soon. Thanks again for the coffee and the heads up about scorpion tackle
looks like a decent catch!  got to love the fight those fish give.  im not into carp that much but it is better then not fishing thats for sure!  cheers!

Growing up in Storm Lake, Iowa, we used to throw them on the bank when we caught carp. The Carp Farm is what we called the lake for a few years. I've never actually tried catching them, but I will admit some of the best fights came from carp. Those hard, side-to-side pulls lasted a long time when your a kid using a zebco reel and a five foot rod from the local hardware store. Once and a while the lake would get really low and we'd find huge ones dead on the banks.
Nice fish!...Nothing like hearing the sound of your bite alarm go off...Music to the ears...Or to a lesser extent, the bell to Pavlov's dogs (at least for me).
